decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly and efficiently get out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath by using cards like Show and Tell and Omniscience. The deck includes plenty of card draw and manipulation, along with counterspells like Force of Will to protect your combo. Cunning Wish provides additional options and versatility. Overall, the goal is to cheat big threats into play early in the game and overwhelm the opponent before they can set up their own game plan.

The deck focuses on using artifacts to ramp up quickly and disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also having access to powerful blue planeswalkers and creatures. The core strategy revolves around playing multiple artifacts in the early game to power out big threats like Urza and Karn, while also utilizing cards like Chalice of the Void and Narset to control the opponent's resources. Mishra's Bauble and Echo of Eons provide card advantage and manipulation, while Sai, Master Thopterist can generate tokens for additional pressure. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and disruptive game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly and efficiently in order to cast a high number of spells in a single turn, ultimately leading to a powerful finishing move such as Tendrils of Agony. The deck includes various cards that help with mana acceleration and card selection, as well as protection from disruption with cards like Veil of Summer and Defense Grid. The deck also includes Burning Wish for additional flexibility in accessing key spells from the sideboard.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Sprite Dragon while utilizing powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning to control the board and finish off the opponent. The deck focuses on card selection and manipulation through cards like Ponder, Preordain, and Brainstorm to ensure consistency and efficiency. Counterspells like Daze, Force of Will, and Force of Negation are used to protect your threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck runs a package of fetch lands and Wasteland to help fix mana and disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap, efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Sprite Dragon to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. It is designed to attack aggressively while disrupting the opponent's game plan with countermagic like Daze, Force of Negation, and Force of Will. The deck also includes powerful burn spells like Chain Lightning, Lightning Bolt, and Pyroblast to finish off opponents or remove key threats. With a mana base focused on fetching dual lands and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base, this deck aims to win the game quickly through aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The key strategy is to establish a board presence with the enchantment Standstill, which allows the player to draw cards while preventing the opponent from playing additional threats. The inclusion of cards like Moat and Supreme Verdict further solidifies the control aspect of the deck, while cards like Shark Typhoon provide a win condition. The companion Kaheera adds an additional layer of synergy and value to the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the graveyard as a resource to quickly bring out powerful creatures such as Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Vengevine. Cards like Bloodghast and Gravecrawler are used to repeatedly bring back creatures from the graveyard, while cards like Altar of Dementia and Bridge from Below provide additional graveyard manipulation and value. The deck also includes cards like Cabal Therapy to disrupt opponents' strategies and accelerate its own game plan. Overall, the key strategy of this combo deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient graveyard-based threats.

The deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures into play by using the card "Show and Tell" to cheat them onto the battlefield. It also includes counterspells and card draw to protect the combo and find necessary pieces. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand while disrupting their game plan with cards like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler. Through careful selection of cards and efficient play, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent can react effectively.

The deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Oko, Thief of Crowns along with efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to control the game. It also utilizes card advantage and manipulation through cards like Brainstorm and Ponder, while also incorporating ramp and value from Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Ice-Fang Coatl. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and out-value them with a combination of versatile threats and answers, ultimately grinding out a win through attrition and resource management.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Chalice of the Void. The deck aims to use Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple to accelerate its mana production, allowing for powerful plays as early as the first few turns. By utilizing cards like Matter Reshaper and Reality Smasher, the deck can apply pressure and close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive lands like Wasteland and Mishra's Factory helps to keep the opponent on the back foot.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the combo pieces needed to cast Doomsday, which allows the player to set up their library in a specific order to win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes numerous card draw, filtering, and disruption spells to help find and protect the combo pieces. The inclusion of cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal provide additional mana acceleration to enable a faster win condition. The deck aims to efficiently combo off and win the game before the opponent can disrupt the plan.

The deck focuses on maintaining control over the game by efficiently removing threats with various removal spells and countering opponent's spells with Force of Will. It also utilizes card draw and manipulation with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Sylvan Library to ensure a steady flow of resources. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Oko, Thief of Crowns serve as powerful threats and versatile answers, while Ice-Fang Coatl provides card advantage and additional removal. The mana base is optimized with dual lands and snow basics for consistency and flexibility.

The deck's strategy revolves around utilizing Cloudpost and its related lands to ramp into powerful ramp targets such as Primeval Titan and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. Cards like Crop Rotation and Expedition Map help to search for the necessary lands, while Pithing Needle and other protection spells ensure the combo pieces stay safe. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large threats and powerful ramp, utilizing the synergy between Cloudpost and other lands to accelerate its game plan quickly and efficiently.

This Canadian Threshold Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf while disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Dreadhorde Arcanist, and finish off the opponent with efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The mana base is designed to support a streamlined strategy and take advantage of the powerful card draw and manipulation spells like Brainstorm and Ponder. With a mix of tempo plays and efficient threats, this deck aims to apply pressure and overwhelm the opponent early in the game.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana using creatures like Heritage Druid and Gaea's Cradle to power out explosive combos using cards like Natural Order to search up powerful creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth. The deck also utilizes card draw through cards like Elvish Visionary and Glimpse of Nature to help find combo pieces quickly. The deck also has a toolbox aspect with Green Sun's Zenith to find specific creatures when needed. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a large number of powerful creatures and finish the game quickly.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Grave Crawler, and Vengevine to bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard. Using cards like Altar of Dementia and Bridge from Below, the deck can fuel its combo potential to overwhelm opponents. The inclusion of cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Stitcher's Supplier further enhances the graveyard synergy of the deck. Additionally, Cabal Therapy adds disruption to the opponent's strategy while Careful Study and Once Upon a Time help with card selection and consistency.
